newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuelan shares seen slipping in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Venezuelan shares seen slipping in slow trade.

text.p: Shares on the Caracas Stock Exchange were seen slipping lower in slow trade as markets hold off waiting for new developments, brokers said.
"I don't think there will be many changes from Tuesday. The market will be slow and erratic because investors are holding off," said Mario Simosa of the Multinvest brokerage.
Brokers said the announcement of final figures for the allocation of the local tranche of CANTV shares later on Wednesday could boost trading in the new stock.
The market's 19-share index fell 1.83 percent on Tuesday to 5,997.89.
